title: Canada hits pause on trade mission to India after tensions at G20 summit
description: A spokesperson for Canadian Trade Minister Mary Ng confirmed the October trip was on hold amid frosty relations.

title: US to conduct new interviews into the deadly 2021 bombing at Kabul airport
description: The suicide bombing killed 170 Afghans and 13 US service members during the messy US withdrawal in August 2021.

title: Hungary, Poland, Slovakia to continue own bans on Ukraine grains
description: Farmers in countries neighbouring Ukraine have repeatedly complained about a product glut hitting their domestic prices.

title: Are Russia and North Korea forming a new alliance?
description: North Korea's Kim Jong Un has pledged his full and unconditional support for Russia's leader.

title: British nurse Lucy Letby to appeal convictions for killing seven babies
description: The 33-year-old was found guilty of killing five baby boys and two baby girls and sentenced to life in prison.

title: Biden calls for ‘win-win’ deal to resolve US auto workers’ strike
description: US president sends two government officials to Detroit, says corporate profits have not been shared fairly with workers.

title: Macron says French ambassador ‘literally being held hostage’ in Niger
description: France's Sylvain Itte is living off 'rations', Macron says, accusing Niger's ruling army of blocking food deliveries.

title: ‘Bold and beloved’: Palestinians mourn teenager killed by Israel
description: Milad al-Raee, 16, was shot in the back by an Israeli soldier at entrance to al-Arroub refugee camp near Hebron.

title: ‘Desert turned into a sea’: Eastern Libya flood survivors recount horror
description: Survivors of floods that struck eastern Libya tell Al Jazeera they remain without aid and struggle to find loved ones.

title: Biden to highlight US commitment to UN next week in New York, envoy says
description: Linda Thomas-Greenfield says Washington is committed to multilateralism ahead of high-level UN General Assembly talks.

title: Bahrain activist Maryam al-Khawaja denied boarding on UK to Manama flight
description: Activist says she wants to meet her jailed father Abdulhadi al-Khawaja who is currently on hunger strike.

title: US announces new Iran sanctions as prisoner swap looms
description: Washington targets Iranian officials and state-linked media outlets on first anniversary of Mahsa Amini's death.

title: EU regulator slaps TikTok with $368m fine for violating privacy laws
description: The Chinese-owned video platform breached laws on the processing of children's personal data, the EU regulator said.

title: Colombian artist Fernando Botero, ‘painter of our virtues’, dies aged 91
description: Botero's works of plump and slightly Surreal forms are on display in museums and public spaces around the world.

title: ‘Day without Meta’: Canada journalists urge boycott of Instagram, Facebook
description: Journalists urge one-day boycott of Meta platforms for company's decision to block news in Canada over contentious law.

title: UK sanctions senior Iranian officials one year from Mahsa Amini’s death
description: The culture minister and the mayor of Tehran are among those blacklisted on the eve of Amini's first death anniversary.

title: Spain’s former football boss Rubiales in court over World Cup kiss scandal
description: Luis Rubiales appears before a judge probing a complaint of sexual assault over forcibly kissing player Jenni Hermoso.

title: US northeast, Atlantic Canada brace for Hurricane Lee
description: Storm expected to bring heavy rain, wind and offshore waves to parts of New England and eastern Canada, forecasters say.

title: We should all support Biden’s war on Big Pharma
description: If we want cutting-edge medicines at a price we can afford, the US president will need to stand his ground.

title: Russia’s central bank raises key interest rate amid weaker rouble
description: The third rate hike in two months comes as Russia grapples with higher inflation and a weaker rouble.

title: Mahsa Amini One Year On
description: “There are definitely differences.”

title: ‘Shattered’: Muslim engineer killed by mob at mosque in India’s Maharashtra
description: The family of Nurul Hassan grieves his lynching during attack by a Hindu mob at a mosque in the state's Satara district.

title: India’s opposition alliance to boycott ‘hate-filled’ TV news anchors
description: Congress-led alliance accuses some anchors of partisanship towards PM Narendra Modi's Hindu nationalist government.

title: Pita Limjaroenrat, leader of Thailand’s Move Forward Party, resigns
description: The 43-year-old steps down so party can name member to serve as parliament's opposition leader.

title: Spain’s Franco-era torture victim to testify in court for first time
description: A hearing opens in Madrid that will see Julio Pacheco Yepes recount his torture in 1975 for opposing the dictatorship.

title: Despite Russia’s war, house prices in some parts of Ukraine still rise
description: Property has lost value significantly in towns near the front lines, but prices in the west rose by up to 75 percent

title: Apple to update iPhone 12 in France after concerns over radiation
description: France's digital minister says the US tech firm will implement the update to the smartphone in the next few days.

title: Key Afghanistan-Pakistan border crossing reopens after nine days
description: Torkham crossing was closed after forces from both sides exchanged fire, stranding travellers and trucks.

title: Flooding death toll soars to 11,300 in Libya’s coastal city of Derna
description: A further 10,100 people are reported missing in Libya's Mediterranean city after a storm caused devastating flooding.

title: Global climate protesters demand governments phase out fossil fuels
description: More than one million protesters will gather globally over the weekend to demand an end to the burning of fossil fuels.

title: Climate change displacement: ‘One of the defining challenges’
description: As volatile weather patterns continue, some communities are being forced to move to survive.

title: The ‘tarnished legacy’ of Pakistan’s retiring top judge Umar Ata Bandial
description: Lahore-born judge's tenure lasted 20 months after he took over as the country faced a serious political crisis.

title: $5 and $10 a week: A savings club helps women in Zimbabwe make ends meet
description: After the loss of her husband, a hawker finds an informal support system in a country where many people distrust banks.

title: China’s factory output improves, offering hope of easing economic slowdown
description: Investment in real estate continues to fall, underscoring weakness in all-important property sector.

title: Map: Which MENA countries have diplomatic ties with Israel?
description: Following the signing of the Abraham Accords in 2020, five Arab states in total have diplomatic ties with Israel.

title: North Korea’s Kim checks out fighter jets in latest stop on Russian tour
description: Kim Jong Un was shown around the Komsomolsk plant, which produces some of Russia's most advanced war planes.

title: US autoworkers launch historic strike at GM, Ford and Stellantis plants
description: Union begins picketing at plants operated by General Motors, Ford and Stellantis for first time in its 88-year history.

title: Protests in Indonesia as thousands face eviction for Rempang ‘Eco-City’
description: Residents have been told to move to new houses inland by the end of the month to make way for a giant glass factory.

title: Romania ups flight restrictions at Ukraine border as drone debris found
description: Russian drone debris found in Romanian territory as Moscow increases drone attacks on Ukraine's Danube river ports.

title: Li Shangfu: What do we know so far about China’s missing defence minister
description: Li was last seen in Beijing at the end of August when he gave a keynote address at a forum with African countries.

title: India’s dirty, hush-hush truth: Hindu children are being radicalised
description: It's happening in schools and homes. And while Modi's BJP might gain, generations of India's Hindus will lose.

title: Malaysia penalises 400 companies so far this year for violating labour laws
description: Human Resources Minister V Sivakumar says firms have been fined more than $500,000 over breaches in 2023.

title: Princess Diana’s iconic ‘Black Sheep’ sweater sells at auction for $1.1m
description: Knitted sweater fetches the highest price ever paid at auction for a garment once belonging to Princess Diana.

title: Russia-Ukraine war: List of key events, day 569
description: As the war enters its 569th day, these are the main developments.

title: ‘A small fish in a sea of sharks’: The isle caught between China and Taiwan
description: Amid tensions with China, people on the longtime Taiwanese frontline island of Kinmen warn against a return to war.

title: US Republicans demand full sanctions, charges against China’s Huawei, SMIC
description: GOP lawmakers call for tougher measures after release of Huawei smartphone raises doubts about US export controls.

title: Ukraine says Russian missile defence destroyed in Crimea, 2 warships hit
description: Russian S-400 'Triumf' surface-to-air missile defence system was reportedly destroyed in 'special operation' in Crimea.

title: Putin, Kim gift each other rifles at meeting, and a Russian space glove
description: Russia's Putin presented North Korea's Kim with a Russian rifle of the 'highest quality' and received a gun in return.

title: Control grocery prices or face new taxes, Canada’s Trudeau warns chains
description: Canadian leader says profits should not be made 'on the backs of people who are struggling to feed their families'.

title: Japan’s Prime Minister Fumio Kishida banks on women to revive his fortunes
description: Kishida's public support is flagging amid concerns about sluggish wage growth and the rising cost of living.
